Description: Shoulder sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style black-figured pottery amphora; exterior,cream slip: above, black figure frieze with part of griffin to right (most of head and hind legs missing) with added red on body and feathers; crosses, dashes and pin wheel rosette as filling ornament; below, wide black band with added red band lined in white, above frieze with part of maeander pattern.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by City Art Gallery and Museum, Bristol. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.005)
